headline: Two-Ingredient Pizza Dough
description: This 2-ingredient pizza dough is super simple to make with just self-rising flour and Greek yogurt for a tender, crisp crust in less than 30 minutes.

video.description: Wondering how to make dough at home? This 2-ingredient dough is unbelievably versatile and easy to make. Use this simple dough recipe for homemade pizza, fluffy garlic knots, or fresh bagels in minutes. The secret ingredients? Greek yogurt and flour!
video.name: We Tried This 2-Ingredient Dough Recipe 3 Ways

name: Two-Ingredient Pizza Dough
recipeIngredient: 1.5 cups self-rising flour, plus more for kneading

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C).

Mix flour and Greek yogurt together in a bowl to form a dough; transfer to a work surface floured with self-rising flour. Knead dough, adding more flour as needed to keep dough from being too sticky, about 8 to 10 minutes.
Spray a 12-inch pizza pan with cooking spray and spread dough to the edges of the pan.
Bake pizza crust in preheated oven for 5 to 7 minutes; add your favorite toppings and return to the preheated oven. Bake until crust is lightly browned, 5 to 7 minutes more.

review.reviewBody: This was fantastic just as is! I was very happy with the easiness of this recipe!! 2 ingredients=wonderful! Next time, I will add the suggested garlic, basil....but I wanted to try it as is first. I will definitely make this and all the other suggestions! Thank you for sharing this awesome recipe!
Great recipe! I added garlic powder, onion, basil, and parsley to the dough. It is delish!
So simple, and perfect, I will be making this again.
I think this is absolutely brilliant. It tasted SO good and was a hit with the whole family. Two ingredients? You cannot beat this taste. Amazing!

Light, Easy and delicious. Used tipo pasta '00' flour and converted that to Self Raising Flour. I had to use extra flour to reduce the stickyness but it didnt change the cooking outcome. Will use this recipe from now on instead of buying pizza bases. Will do this to make mini lunch pizzas in the airfryer üòä

Being gluten free due to allergies, getting good pizza is a challenge. I usually make a yeast dough and dedicate the entire batch to 6" pizza crusts---and that's very tasty. Since I was out of MY pre-made crusts, I wanted to try this recipe. I read other reviews and added a few things to the crust; basil, oregano and garlic powder. I also replaced some of the greek yogurt with mayonnaise, which I like to think made the crust less biscuity!

We really enjoyed pizza with this dough. I will say that it tastes better if you add garlic powder and sea salt to the flour before mixing in the Greek yogurt. We used pepperoni, bacon, mozerella and parmesean cheese to the top. Be aware that the crust will be thick.
I‚Äôve made this for several years now, my secret is I use medium grind yellow cornmeal to roll it out, gives the crust a little extra crunch.
This was very simple to do it was worth making :) I definitely recommend for others to try out

I liked that its a good place to start. For my version I had to use a good deal of flour more to get it unsticky. then again I did triple the recipe haha. For the crust to make it more tasty I added garlic butter and oregano before adding topping and then at the end as I pulled it out. for my pizza sauce I used pesto added some cheeses and meat I had cooked yesterday and today. ty for the recipe.

I have tried so many different dough recipes and none turned out great due to living at high altitude. But this one worked perfectly! I can‚Äôt believe it! I was very skeptical about the Greek yogurt but it turned out amazing. I made it a little easier by using my kitchenaid stand mixer with the bread dough hook. Worker perfectly! I also used the Mushroom Thyme White pizza recipe for the topping and it all turned out excellent.
Easy peasy üçï 7mins in the oven on full and it's perfect. I used equal parts s/r flour and Yoghurt but had to add flour until it stopped sticking.
I like making pizza , this dough is just so sticky every time . I have to keep adding more and more flour. I haven't read any reviews that say the same. Wondering if it is something I do wrong ...

When you do not have time for a yeast raised pizza dough, this recipe is what you want! Most important is use a pizza stone in your oven -heat it at the same time you‚Äôre heating the oven. Once you‚Äôve rolled and formed the pizza dough to the size you want, grab some yellow cornmeal, sprinkle it on your pizza peel. Place your dough on top of the pizza peel, and the dough will easily slide onto your hot pizza stone to parbake. I made a pesto margarita pizza -so delicious!

Wow! This was incredible! The easiest pizza dough I‚Äôve ever made and tastes great. I followed directions but did let my dough sit a bit before rolling it out. I only prebaked the crust for 5 minutes but will bake it 7 next time. And there will be a next time!

This pizza dough is super awesome!!! It totally comes in handy when you're in a pinch and don't have time to make a yeast dough. I've made this several times already. One thing to note, I do NOT keep self rising flour on hand so I simply added baking soda and salt to my all purpose flour and viola, instant self rising flour. Will definitely be adding this easy week-night pizza dough into my dinner rotation.

I doubled the recipe. I had to add 1/4 cup more of 5% Greek Yogurt to get the dough to come together. I also had to add a bit more flour. I'm guessing a couple of T. of self rising flour. I let the dough rest for about 30 min. covered with a tea towel. I baked the crust for the suggested 7 min. at 500 degrees on a 15 inch pizza stone. I added the sauce, pepperoni, Italian sausage and onion. I then baked the pizza for about 11 more min. The crust was thick. So, if you like thick crust, this pizza dough is for you. I think next time, I will bake the crust for 10 min. Then, I will probably have to babysit the pizza and bake for 7 or more minutes. You can tell the pizza is done when the cheese starts to melt and the pepperoni starts to curl. I might even make 2 pizzas out of the dough.

This dough was great! I can't believe I can whip up a pizza dough so quickly! I did let it rest for a few minutes after kneading and before rolling it out. I also par-baked it for about 5 minutes at 500 degrees before topping and finishing baking at 450. It turned out delicious!
I loved this pizza base recipe quick easy to make lovely golden crust.i didn't have greek yoghurt so I used sour milk its still gave me beautiful results
Really good, but for a better texture I prefer using Indian yogurt.
TWO ingredients ! I chopped up fresh herbs and added to the dough for a herbed pizza crust. It is SO easy and makes a fabulous pizza! It's a MUST have in your recipe collection!
Delicious and so easy to make!
Oh yeah
Great thin crust pizza. I have tried recipe after recipe trying to get a dough hubby and I liked. This recipe is it.

Easy plastic! I made with sauce, cheese, ham, pineapple chunks and black olives. I rolled out my dough thin, added olive oil on top. Baked 7 min at 500. Added toppings baked for another 7 minutes. Yum
Super good :)
The first time I made this, even my wife enjoyed the results. I'm going to use it again.
I didn‚Äôt make any changes. It was fun kneading dough and it tastes yummy and will save me money and I used Prego Classic marinara sauce
I was pleasantly surprised. The crust was awesome. I added garlic granules, onion powder, and Italian seasoning to the crust. It was quick and easy, and I will definitely make it again.

This is the weight watcher's use if for everything recipe. Bagels, pizza, cinnamon rolls, etc. I wouldn't make this my recipe for everyday pizza, but if you're on weight watchers, it's a good substitute.
I was so skeptical that this would not turn out well, but it was delicious. I will make it again & might as some herbs just for a kick of flavor.

This is a great, super easy recipe and my go to for not only pizza dough but also everything bagels! We add 1 packet of sweetener to it as a friend said hers tasted a bit too much like yogurt after taste. We have never had that with this addition. Clete
This is a great 2-ingredient dough! Especially considering that it has non-fat Greek yogurt. So there is a SLIGHT difference in taste; however, that‚Äôs only to be expected. And it is WW friendly!
Amazing recipe loved the crust!!

This is now my go-to pizza dough recipe! No need to be intimidated - just follow the simple instructions. It is, as the other reviews state, easy to modify to your tastes. We used to buy pre-made crusts, but no more - home made is way healthier!

It works! I did have to use a lot more flour, but maybe that's because my yogurt was not Greek (higher water content?). Like others, I also didn't have self-rising flour and use a recipe from here to make some.

This pizza dough is very good. I would suggest to use a lot of corn meal to cover the pizza stone entirely. Otherwise, your pizza might stick to the edges. Another suggestion is to let the dough relax for about 5 minutes before you roll it. I would say that this dough is good for two small pizzas or one 14" pie. The dough was chewy/dense but really nice. I also see a good calzone or two.

I made it and it's phenomenal! Add a 1/2 teaspoon of garlic powder for extra flavor. spread cornmeal on your pizza peel for extra crunch. And always use a pizza stone at high heat for best results. We bake ours on the grill with a smoker box for superior wood-fired taste.
Amazing

This recipe works just fine when a quick snack or meal is in order. I made it with both cow and goat yogurt with success. I suggest par baking the crust on a pizza stone for 5-6 minutes before adding toppings before the final bake. This results in a nicely baked crust bottom and firm crust for toppings.
Perfect recipe and so fresh and delicious!

I've always wanted to make my own pizza dough since I make my own sauce, but I don't do a lot with yeast. This couldn't have been easier and tasted like something from a pizza parlor! will definitely be my go-to dough now.

I LOOOOVE this pizza crust. Super easy to make. We've been cooking pizzas on our green egg trying different crusts. This is the one for us. I make it exactly as is and its great. The last few times Ive been adding Chef Paul Prudhomme‚Äôs Herbal Pizza and Pasta Magic Seasoning Blend to the dough. This is even better in my opinion to change it up. Either way you make it is great.

I just made it and noticed there are no baking times listed so it looks good
I just hope its not overdone or underdone
For a firmer dough for a sicilian pizza pie used 2 cups of self raising flour and 1 cup of yogurt.

I made this twice. 2nd time was better. I modified the crust by adding 1/4 teaspoon garlic pepper and 2 tablespoons of parmesan cheese to the dough and a tablespoon of olive oil. These may have increased the calories, but made the dough less bland. Hubby liked my modified version better too! Spread dough thin and toppings are always a plus!! Easy cheesy!
I made it and I loved it. Simple and tasty the way I like it.
This was easy and delicious. The pizza need to bake at 450-500 for 10-15 minutes for best results.

Have made this several times. If you follow directions, this comes out perfect every time. Rises on the edges beautifully and has a wonderful flavor just as is. I have also experimented and added a touch of garlic powder and Italian seasoning. Really good but prefer the original.

Really bad, like a biscuit not a pizza. Thick and bready. I ate a couple of slices only.
However if you like biscuits slathered with pizza toppings, this one's for you
Easiest and quickest pizza base ever taste great too
We have been making this for years..it is the best! Fresh basil, pesto sliced tomatoes, saut√©ed mushrooms and cheese - Boom!

I read the reviews and tried this last night, one review described this perfectly = grade school lunch room pizza. Made exactly as is it's pretty much inedible. i just had cheese and pepperoni as toppings and cooked at 500 like instructed the dough was rubbery and the pepperoni was burning on the edges before the crust started to brown.

Not going to make this disaster again.
Thank you! It was very yummy
Amazing. Made exactly as is many times for pizza, stromboli, calzone, and more. It's perfect.
Nice easy delicious pizza crust, My 6 year old loved loved loved this.
Very easy and tasted great!

The recipe only calls for yogurt and dough, so if you have high expectations: don't. 
The only reason I can't give more stars is because the recipe isn't very thorough (no temp/time info).
I ended up adding 1 tablespoon italian seasoning, 2/3 tablespoons garlic powder (I really like garlic), and about 1/2 teaspoon sea salt to my dough. I think next time I'd only add about 2/3 tablespoon italian seasoning. Bake at 400F for about 20 minutes.
Again: Don't expect pizzeria quality from FLOUR and YOGURT.

This was delicious! I never buy Greek yogurt, so I just used plain regular yogurt. The dough was very sticky, so I added extra flour, cut into strips, brushed with olive oil, basil, oregano, parsley, salt, pepper, & minced garlic. I halved the recipe because I just wanted bread sticks. They didn't rise as much as I thought they might, but they tasted amazing. 10 mins in the oven on 500¬∞ I should've taken pictures, but we ate them all. Maybe next time?

I love this dough! I used it to make bagels. Form into bagel shapes. Place in a rolling boil pot of water With about a tablespoon of molasses and a teaspoon or two of baking soda. Boil for about a minute and 15 seconds. Remove drain and season with bagel seasoning. Bake in 400¬∞ oven for 18 to 20 minutes.
Super easy to make!!

The recipe is great!
I tweaked a couple things for my own taste - I added herbs to the dough, including rosemary, parsley, and basil. 
I also use honey or lime greek yogurt, it gives an extra little somethin' somethin'.
Love this recipe. So simple!

So easy and delicious! I sprinkle flour on parchment paper and roll it on there. Makes it very easy to then slide on and off of the pan and no mess! I have parbaked the crust and haven‚Äôt noticed much difference.
Easier to spread than regular pizza dough. Surprisingly good, but not as good as the real thing! Great way to use up extra yogurt.
Update: I have made this recipe so many times but it never gets old. So delicious! I no longer remember what a pre made crust tastes like!! It‚Äôs amazing and my whole family loves it.
Excellent! I actually prefer using all purpose flour with 1 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda and 1/2 teaspoon salt instead of self rising. Came out amazing!
I added more Greek yogurt to make a ball. Did not need to add flour like the recipe suggested.

8.3.20 ... https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/244447/two-ingredient-pizza-dough/ ... Outside crust was crispy, but not the bottom. 'Looked just like the photo. 'Kind of reminded me of a not very good frozen pizza. I looked at a few recipes for this. This one had the highest amount of flour with the same amount of Greek Yogurt. It will seem like too much even with the right amount until it's incorporated, but start with less. The dough had me thinking I was dealing with biscuit dough, but - well - it wasn't. Dough that hadn't risen would be more accurate. I am glad I tried, but have no reason to repeat.
this was horrible, laid like a lump in my stomach, and tangy from the yogurt - NOT a ny pizza for sure!!
i made as directed i need leave in a little longer but still for first try notbad
Well I suppose cooking isnt for everyone. It seemed good at first but the dough is just the most sticky thing I have ever encountered.

I loved this pizza dough!
I was running late for an appointment and I had to still make dinner, so I found this recipe and I made dinner in time
Great, easy recipe. Remember to use a lot of flour when kneading. We added saut√©ed garlic to the dough, it tasted great!

3 stars for taste/texture, with an extra star for how easy it is. Definitely not my favorite tasting pizza crust, but you can't beat it for ease of preparation and simple ingredients that are always on-hand.
Our firsr try and we likes it.
best crust,super easy.
If you don't have self rising flour, here's how you make it. You need flour and baking soda! That's it

The dough was very heavy and tasteless. Waste of expensive ingredients. I was curious to try but would not make it again. Baked on a pizza stone in a gas Grill at 500¬∞. Pizza look great and had a nice brown bottom. my guest had one piece and we did not eat the rest
I am making it again. I don‚Äôt buy sel-rising flour. I use an organic unbleached flour. I added some baking soda, worked fine.

Didn't do anything for me. I subbed oil and water for the yogurt which made a palatable "pizza" dough, using self rising flour - no need for baking powder. Yeast isn't on the shelves and the yogurt goes quickly, as does butter, milk, cottage cheese. Lots of singles don't have lots of ingredients but oil isn't out if the way as is a big box of baking powder, I may use once a year. Self rising flour, which calls for no baking powder, is the way to go. So is pizza dough made with no yogurt.

I have a bread maker for making dough, but in comparison this recipe truly is the best. Quick and easy, and no one knows that it‚Äôs a healthy dough. I‚Äôve made several pizzas and each one is just as good as the other, depending on your choice of toppings. I would soooo recommend this recipe to all the busy moms out there. Easy and quick! LMB
Made many times and have used gluten free SR flour too - works just as good! So simple, perfect every time. Thanks!

Easy peesy! I was a skeptic but it worked beautifully. Follow the directions that say bake in 500 degree oven...which I thought would burn the crust, but it didn‚Äôt. My toppings were Italian sausage, sweet peppers, and olives with Provolone Cheese.

I was "that guy" - I had plain yogurt and not Greek, so I tried that. And, I had AP flour, so I added baking powder as others have recommended.

Doubled the batch, and kept having to add flour - close to another full "double" on just that. Ended up about right. My KA did the initial mixing and then I did the "why isn't this working?" troubleshooting on my own muscle.

I took others' suggestions and added Parmesan and garlic powder in the dough. I liked that a lot. My ratios were off in the end, but it was still nice. 

I thought I'd have spare dough for breadsticks, but I ended up with two pizzas. And, I figured out why pizza chains (etc) don't add toppings to the very ends - the mozzarella melted and land-slid the pepperonis all over the place (NOT off the pan, thankfully). 

With ALL of that going on, I threw my fates to the winds and just hoped - and when it was all done, my husband said that was my best pizza dough so far. (I dooo have a checkered history with pizza dough, TBH.) The housemate who doesn't like pizza went back for seconds.

WOW. This recipe ruined my favorite pizzeria for me. I think my taste better. Easy and delicious. I made a thin crust and topped it with pesto sauce, chicken, red onions, artichokes hearts and fontina cheese. Thanks!
I would have liked to see a direction as to how long to bake. Mine turned out slightly undercooked in middle, browned nicely on bottom. Maybe it is meant to be a very, very thin crust ?
I made this over the weekend, and it looked delicious but I couldn't get past the tangy aftertaste that I'm sure was from the plain yogurt.

We have two gluten-free daughters, so I had them make one pizza with GF flour, and one for me and their Dad with regular flour. LOVED THEM, all four of us!! Super simple. The twins were especially impressed because they normally pay big bucks for GF pizza, while this was quick, easy, delicious...and cheap! Anyway, would suggest less sauce and not more, cheese first and veggies or meat on top - both of these suggestions may help the finished pizza be a bit less "soggy". However, the girls dressed the pizzas, and they put the mountain of fresh veggies and meat down first, and cheese last. The reverse works better, so that might be the cause of our slightly soggy crust. Will have to try again! Also, though we didn't want to cook them on the bare oven rack, since the dough was fresh, not frozen or "stiff", we used a regular cookie sheet ...and I think it would be worth trying with a pizza pan with some holes in it. Or maybe we could have put a layer of cornmeal down on the cookie sheet and that would have helped? That might have given the crust a bit more "authentic" a crust. Would also suggest flavoring the crust with a bit of salt, and then adding olive oil and some garlic powder and Italian seasoning after adding the sauce, but before adding the cheese and veggies and meat. A little more flavor to the crust would probably be delicious! I'll try to update this review when we make this again. Thanks for the recipe though - it's def going to be used again and again!

Will absolutely make again! Had to read reviews to get cooking time. At 7200 feet so baked crust 8 min@ 450, added toppings and baked @ 500 for 10 min and perfection. Will make every week now. All family loved
Followed someone else‚Äôs advice and cooked crust for 7 minutes then pulled it out and topped it and finished it off. Turned out great!

The dough was phenomenal! I was very skeptical when I saw the recipe as I make pizza every week and my dough is a very traditional dough that I normally make 2 days ahead of time! This recipe was SUPER easy and quick. I did not precook the dough I just made the pizza and cooked it in the oven at the usual 500F! You've got to try it!
i made this! the only problem i had was the crust was tough. not sure why though and comments would be appreciated. thanks

Seriously the easiest pizza crust I've ever made! This will be my new go to. No changes necessary.
Delicious!

Turn out better than. If I used yeast. The crust had good flavor. Made a supreme which turned out great. Next time I will pre cook the crust as suggested by some reviewers. We put pizza in the air fryer to make crust a little crisp.

I prefer pizza crusts on the thin side, and this crust has some heft to it. That said, it tasted really good and if you like your crust thick, this is a great crust for that. The kneading gets tiresome after a while, but for simplicity's sake it's worth the trouble.
Surprisingly good!

It was quick and easy 
I would make it again
Looking for something different to try and this fit the bill! Super easy, fast and delicious! First home made pizza is a keeper.
